definition: to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)

sentences.english: There were two cotton red vest, four bib and socks.
sentences.chinese: 有兩件紅色的棉馬夾，四個圍嘴，還有好幾雙襪子。

sentences.english: Don' t tuck it into your belt or use it as a bib .
sentences.chinese: 不要把它塞在你的皮帶裏，或將其當作圍嘴兒用。

sentences.english: Ok , take off the bib . Go to play.
sentences.chinese: 好了，把圍嘴摘下來，去那邊玩去吧。

sentences.english: The old child may use a bib with short ties.
sentences.chinese: 較大的幼兒可用短帶的圍嘴。

sentences.english: Products include "Yunjian" embroidered bags and bibs used for children.
sentences.chinese: 在產品上有“雲肩”繡包，及兒童用的圍嘴等。

sentences.english: The baby was slobbering all over her bib.
sentences.chinese: 這個嬰兒正在流口水，流遍整個圍嘴。

sentences.english: Babies often dribbles on their bibs.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒常流口水在圍嘴上。

sentences.english: She tied a bib under her son's chin.
sentences.chinese: 她在兒子下巴底下繫上圍嘴。
